# NSColorPickingDefault

**Protocol**

A set of methods that provides basic behavior for a color picker.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NSColorPickingDefault
```

## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorPickingDefault] protocol, together with the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorPickingCustom] protocol (which provides implementation-specific behavior), provides an interface for adding color pickers to an app’s color panel.

## Creating Color Pickers

- **init(pickerMask:colorPanel:)**: Initializes the receiver with a given color panel and its mode.

## Configuring Color Pickers

- **setMode(_:)**: Specifies the receiver’s mode.
- **insertNewButtonImage(_:in:)**: Sets the image of a given button cell.
- **provideNewButtonImage()**: Provides the image of the button used to select the receiver in the color panel.
- **minContentSize()**: Indicates the receiver’s minimum content size.
- **buttonToolTip()**: Provides the toolbar button help tag.

## Handling Events

- **alphaControlAddedOrRemoved(_:)**: Sent when the color panel’s opacity controls have been hidden or displayed.
- **viewSizeChanged(_:)**: Tells the recever when the color panel’s view size changes in a way that might affect the color picker.

## Managing Color Lists

- **attachColorList(_:)**: Tells the receiver to attach the given color list, if it isn’t already displaying the list.
- **detachColorList(_:)**: Tells the receiver to detach the given color list, unless the receiver isn’t displaying the list.

## Color Panels

- **NSColorPanel**: A standard user interface for selecting color in an app.
- **NSColorPickingCustom**: A set of methods that provides a way to add color pickers—custom user interfaces for color selection—to an app’s color panel.
- **NSColorPicker**: An abstract superclass that implements the default color picking protocol.

## Inherited By

- NSColorPickingCustom

## Conforming Types

- NSColorPicker
